meaning: verb: to be one's duty or obligation
example: The teacher looked down at the student and said, "It would behoove you to be in class on time and complete your homework, so that you don't repeat freshman English for a third straight year."

meaning: verb: to envy someone for possessing or enjoying something
example: Sitting all alone in his room, Harvey begrudged the happiness of the other children playing outside his window.

meaning: verb: cause annoyance in; disturb, especially by minor irritations
example: Dan is usually calm and balanced, but it takes only one intense glare from Sabrina to rile him.

meaning: adjective: highly unconventional or unusual (usually describes a person)
example: Mozart was well-known for his eccentricities, often speaking words backward to confuse those around him.

meaning: verb: be widespread in a particular area at a particular time; be current:
example: During the labor negotiations, an air of hostility prevailed in the office.

meaning: adjective: marked by defiant disregard for danger or consequences
example: The police regularly face dangerous situations, so for a police officer not to wear his bullet-proof vest is foolhardy.

meaning: adjective: easily handled or managed; willing to be taught or led or supervised or directed
example: Barnyard animals are considerably more docile than the wild animals.

meaning: adjective: fraught with danger
example: People smoke to relax and forget their cares, but ironically, in terms of health risks, smoking is far more precarious than either mountain-climbing or skydiving.

meaning: adjective: dull and uninteresting
example: The movie director was known for hiring beautiful actors in order to deflect attention away from the insipid scripts he would typically use.

meaning: noun: leniency and compassion shown toward offenders by a person or agency charged with administering justice
example: In the final moments of the trial, during his closing speech, Phillips was nearly begging the judge for clemency.

meaning: verb: damage the good name and reputation of someone
example: The prince's distasteful choice of words besmirched not only his own name but also the reputation of the entire royal family.

meaning: verb: attribute or credit to
example: History ascribes The Odyssey and The Iliad to Homer, but scholars now debate whether he was a historical figure or a fictitious name.

meaning: adjective: characterized by hard work and perseverance
example: Pete was an industrious student, completing every assignment thoroughly and on time.

meaning: verb: achieve something by means of trickery or devious methods
example: Steven was able to finagle one of the last seats on the train by convincing the conductor that his torn stub was actually a valid ticket.

meaning: verb: make stronger or defensible
example: China's economy has been buttressed by a global demand for the electronic parts the country manufactures.

meaning: adjective: similar in some respects but otherwise different
example: In many ways, the Internet's transformative effect on society has been analogous to that of the printing press.

meaning: adjective: stopping and starting at irregular intervals
example: The intermittent thunder continued and the night was punctuated by cracks of lightningâ€”a surreal sleepless night.

meaning: adjective: quickly aroused to anger
example: If Arthur's dog is not fed adequately, he becomes highly irascible, even growling at his own shadow.

meaning: verb: precede in time
example: Harry was so unknowledgeable that he was unaware the Egyptian pharaohs antedated the American Revolution.

meaning: adjective: excessively forward
example: Many felt that Barney was presumptuous in moving into the large office before the management even made any official announcement of his promotion.

meaning: verb: fuse or cause to grow together
example: Over time, the various tribes coalesced into a single common culture with one universal language.

meaning: verb: make furious
example: When Herb bought football tickets for a game on the day of their wedding anniversary, Jill was incensed.

meaning: adjective: without check or limitation; showing no moral restraints to one's anger, desire, or appetites
example: Due to wanton behavior and crude language, the drunk man was thrown out of the bar and asked to never return.

meaning: adjective: without partiality
example: Teachers often have trouble being evenhanded to all of their varied students.

meaning: adjective: having an agreeably pungent taste
example: The chef, with a mere flick of the salt shaker, turned the bland tomato soup into a piquant meal.

meaning: adjective: marked by a carefree unconventionality or disreputableness
example: As soon as he arrived in the city, the rakish young man bought some drugs and headed straight for the seedy parts of town.

meaning: noun: an act of making something right
example: Barry's redress for forgetting his wife's birthday two years in a row was surprising her with a trip to Tahiti.

meaning: noun: a deep, long-lasting sadness
example: Hamlet is a figure of tremendous melancholy: he doesn't have a truly cheerful scene throughout the entire play.

meaning: verb: collect information bit by bit
example: Herb has given us no formal statement about his background, but from various hints, I have gleaned that he grew up in difficult circumstances.

meaning: adjective: involving intelligence rather than emotions or instinct
example: A cerebral analysis of most pop music finds it to be simple and childish, but that ignores the point--the music's effect on the listener.

meaning: verb: treat or speak of with contempt
example: The nun derided the students for trying to sneak insects and worms into the classroom.

meaning: noun: something, especially an event, that causes difficulty and suffering
example: As of 2013, nearly 1.5 million Syrians have fled their country hoping to escape the tribulations of a civil war tearing their country to pieces.

meaning: verb: convey a meaning; imply
example: By saying that some of the guests were uncomfortable, the manager implicated to the hotel staff that it needed to be more diligent.

meaning: verb: try to gain favor by extreme flattery
example: The media fawned over the handsome new CEO, praising his impeccable sense of style instead of asking more pointed questions.

meaning: adjective: suggesting the operation of supernatural influences; surpassing the ordinary or normal
example: Reggie has an uncanny ability to connect with animals: feral cats will readily approach him, and sometimes even wild birds will land on his finger.

meaning: verb: give an assignment to (a person)
example: Since the senior manager had to go on many international business trips, she was forced to delegate many of her responsibilities to two lower-level managers.

meaning: verb: lessen the importance, dignity, or reputation of
example: A good teacher will never belittle his students, but will instead empower them.

meaning: verb: take the place of or have precedence over
example: A governmental warning about an imminent terrorist attack would preempt ordinary network programming on television.

meaning: verb: strive to equal or match, especially by imitating; compete with successfully
example: To really become fluent in a new language, emulate the speech patterns of people who speak the language.

meaning: verb: turn away
example: Afraid to see the aftermath of the car crash, I averted my eyes as we drove by.

meaning: adjective: necessary (for someone) as a duty or responsibility
example: Middle managers at times make important decisions, but real responsibility for the financial well-being of the corporation is ultimately incumbent on the CEO.

meaning: adjective: given to haughty disregard of others
example: Percy dismissed the issue with a cavalier wave of his hand.

meaning: adjective: characterized by directness in manner or speech; without subtlety or evasion
example: I did not expect the insurance agent to give us any straight answers, but I was pleasantly surprised by how forthright he was.

meaning: adjective: lacking energy
example: Nothing can make a person more lethargic than a big turkey dinner.

meaning: noun: a difficult problem
example: Computers have helped solve some of the mathematical conundrums which have puzzled man for many centuries.

meaning: verb: to make holy or set apart for a high purpose
example: At the church of Notre Dame in France, the new High Altar was consecrated in 1182.

meaning: adjective: well integrated, forming a united whole
example: A well-written, cohesive essay will keep on topic at all times, never losing sight of the main argument.

meaning: adjective: dull and lacking excitement
example: Having grown up in a humdrum suburb, Jacob relished life in New York City after moving.

meaning: noun: the property of being extremely abundant
example: When Maria reported that she had been visited by Jesus Christ and had proof, a profusion of reporters and journalists descended on the town.

meaning: noun: covering consisting of a thin superficial layer that hides the underlying substance
example: Mark Twain referred to the Victorian Period in America as the "Gilded Age", implying the ample moral corruption that lay beneath a mere veneer of respectability.
